document.heading: Audiology and Speech-Language Pathology Amendment Act of 2006

history.narrative: Law 16-219, the “Audiology and Speech-Language Pathology Amendment Act of 2006”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-435, which was referred to Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 14, 2006, and December 5, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 19, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-548 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-219 became effective on March 6, 2007.
